intro: Saussurea anochaete, commonly known as the woolly saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly coating on its stems and leaves, which helps protect it from harsh environmental conditions. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or brown in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
